jsymbolic2.processing

Class SymbolicMusicFileUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsymbolic2.processing.SymbolicMusicFileUtilities

  • public class SymbolicMusicFileUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    A class holding static methods for validating and parsing MIDI and MEI files. Many of these methods in effect check to see if files are valid MIDI or MEI as part of their processing. If they are valid, they are parsed into a MIDI sequence (MEI files are converted to MIDI as part of this processing). If they are not valid, errors are logged in provided error logs and Exceptions are thrown.
    Author:
    Tristano Tenaglia and Cory McKay

    • Method Detail

      • validateAndGetMidiAndMeiFiles

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> validateAndGetMidiAndMeiFiles(java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> files_to_test,
                                                                              java.io.PrintStream status_print_stream,
                                                                              java.io.PrintStream error_print_stream,
                                                                              java.util.List<java.lang.String> error_log)
        Test all of the files specified in files_to_test. Return a list of all of these files that are in fact valid MIDI or MEI files. If one or more files are invalid, then output an error message identifying them. If no valid files are present, then print a message indicating this and end execution.
        Parameters:
        files_to_test - The files to test to see if they are valid MIDI or MEI files.
        status_print_stream - A stream to print general messages to.
        error_print_stream - A stream to print error messages to.
        error_log - Errors that occur during processing are added to this list.
        Returns:
        A list of the valid MIDI and MEI files found in files_to_test.

      • isValidMidiFile

        public static boolean isValidMidiFile(java.io.File file)
        Checks to see if the specified file is a valid MIDI file. This is done by attempting to parse it.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if it is a valid MIDI file, false if it is not.

      • isValidMeiFile

        public static boolean isValidMeiFile(java.io.File file)
        Checks to see if the specified file is a valid MEI file. This is done by attempting to parse it.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if it is a valid MEI file, false if it is not.

      • getMidiSequenceFromMidiOrMeiFile

        public static javax.sound.midi.Sequence getMidiSequenceFromMidiOrMeiFile(java.io.File file,
                                                                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> error_log)
                                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Extracts a MIDI Sequence object from the given MIDI or MEI file. If the file is not a valid MIDI or MEI file, then an exception is thrown and a report is added to error_log.
        Parameters:
        file - A MIDI or MEI file to parse.
        error_log - Errors that occur during processing are added to this list.
        Returns:
        A MIDI Sequence parsed from the given file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An informative Exception is thrown if file is not a valid MIDI or MEI file.

      • getMidiSequenceFromMidiFile

        public static javax.sound.midi.Sequence getMidiSequenceFromMidiFile(java.io.File file,
                                                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> error_log)
                                                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                    javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Extracts a MIDI Sequence object from the given MIDI file. If the file is not a valid MIDI file, then an exception is thrown and a report is added to error_log.
        Parameters:
        file - A MIDI file to parse.
        error_log - Errors that occur during processing are added to this list.
        Returns:
        An MeiSequence parsed from the given MEI file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is a problem accessing the given file.
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - Thrown if the given file is not a valid MIDI file.

      • getMeiSequenceFromMeiFile

        public static org.ddmal.jmei2midi.MeiSequence getMeiSequenceFromMeiFile(java.io.File file,
                                                                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> error_log)
                                                                 throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException,
                                                                        ca.mcgill.music.ddmal.mei.MeiXmlReader.MeiXmlReadException
        Extracts an MeiSequence object from the given MEI file. If the file is not a valid MEI file, then an exception is thrown and a report is added to error_log.
        Parameters:
        file - An MEI file to parse.
        error_log - Errors that occur during processing are added to this list.
        Returns:
        An MeiSequence parsed from the given MEI file.
        Throws:
        ca.mcgill.music.ddmal.mei.MeiXmlReader.MeiXmlReadException - Thrown if there is a problem parsing the MEI in the given file.
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - Thrown if MIDI data extracted from the given MEI file is invalid.

      • getMidiSequenceFromMeiFile

        public static javax.sound.midi.Sequence getMidiSequenceFromMeiFile(java.io.File file,
                                                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> error_log)
                                                            throws ca.mcgill.music.ddmal.mei.MeiXmlReader.MeiXmlReadException,
                                                                   javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Extracts a MIDI Sequence object from the given MEI file. If the file is not a valid MEI file, then an exception is thrown and a report is added to error_log.
        Parameters:
        file - An MEI file to parse.
        error_log - Errors that occur during processing are added to this list.
        Returns:
        A MIDI Sequence parsed from the given MEI file.
        Throws:
        ca.mcgill.music.ddmal.mei.MeiXmlReader.MeiXmlReadException - Thrown if there is a problem parsing the MEI in the given file.
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - Thrown if MIDI data extracted from the given MEI file is invalid.

      • getRecursiveListOfFiles

        public static java.io.File[] getRecursiveListOfFiles(java.lang.String file_or_directory_path,
                                                     java.io.FileFilter file_filter,
                                                     java.io.PrintStream error_print_stream,
                                                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> error_log)
        If the given file_or_directory_path is a file, then simply return it in a single-entry array (it is not subjected to file_filter). If it is a directory, then recursively traverse it and return an array containing all files found that pass the specified file_filter. Print a warning to the given print_stream if no qualifying files are found in the directory
        Parameters:
        file_or_directory_path - A path to a file or to a directory.
        file_filter - A filter through which files parsed from a directory must pass in order to be included in the returned array.
        error_print_stream - A stream to print processing error reports to. May not be null.
        error_log - A list of errors encountered so far. Errors are added to it if any are encountered. May not be null.
        Returns:
        The specified File, if file_or_directory_path refers to a file, or the files parsed from file_or_directory_path if it is a directory. Returns null if the specified file does not refer to an existing file or directory.

      • getFilteredFilesRecursiveTraversal

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> getFilteredFilesRecursiveTraversal(java.util.List<java.io.File> files_and_directories,
                                                                                   boolean filter_explicitly_specified_files,
                                                                                   java.io.FileFilter file_filter,
                                                                                   java.io.PrintStream error_print_stream,
                                                                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> error_log)
        Traverses the provided files_and_directories list and generates a new list consisting of all files in files_and_directories. Any directories referred to in files_and_directories are also traversed recursively, and files found while doing this are also added to the returned list (but only if they pass the requirements of the file_filter, regardless of the value of filter_explicitly_specified_files). Files explicitly mentioned in files_and_directories are only subjected to the file_filter, however, if filter_explicitly_specified_files is set to true. Regardless, the returned list will NOT include any directories directly, only qualifying files found within them.
        Parameters:
        files_and_directories - The set of files and/or directories to traverse.
        filter_explicitly_specified_files - Whether or not files mentioned directly in files_and_directories (i.e. are not just in subfolders of directories mentioned there) should be subjected to file_filter.
        file_filter - A filter through which files must pass in order to be included in the returned list.
        error_print_stream - A stream to print processing error reports to. May be null, in which case errors will still be added to error_log.
        error_log - A list of errors encountered so far. Errors are added to it if any are encountered. May not be null.
        Returns:
        A list of all files in files_and_directories and its recursively traversed sub-directories that passed file_filter. Files explicitly mentioned in files_and_directories that do not pass file_filter will still be included in the returned list if filter_explicitly_specified_files is false.

      • correctFileExtension

        public static java.lang.String correctFileExtension(java.lang.String file_name,
                                                    java.lang.String file_extension)
        Checks if the specified file_name ends with the specified file_extension (preceded by a period). If it does, then return a reference to it unchanged. If it does not, then return a reference to a new string with file_extension (preceded by a period) added to the end of file_name.
        Parameters:
        file_name - The file name to check.
        file_extension - The file extension to check file_name for. This file_extension should not include a period.
        Returns:
        file_name with the proper extension added to it if it is not there already.

      • filePathExists

        public static boolean filePathExists(java.lang.String path_to_check)
        Given a file path, return true if a file (or other resource) at the corresponding path exists, and false if it does not.
        Parameters:
        path_to_check - The file path to check.
        Returns:
        True if a resource exists at path_to_check, false if it does not.
